did.head: Collection Summary
did.physdesc: sound recordings: 2 sound tape reels : analog ; 5 in.
sound recordings: 1 sound disc : analog, 45 rpm ; 7 in.

corpname.part: Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress

did.abstract: Collection of manuscripts and publications comprising the records of the Cooperative Recreation Service (Delaware, Ohio) and additions by subsequent owners, including World Around Songs, a division of Compassion Books, Inc. Includes correspondence with authors and collectors of songs and games; copyright and permission files; most of the original publications of the CRS; folders of individual folk dance and folk song titles pasted-up for publication; and master negatives of songs and games for publication. Genres include American and International folk songs, Contemporary songs, Humorous songs, Work songs, Carols, Rounds, Spirituals, Hymns, and Canons. Popular titles published by the Cooperative Recreation Service include: Handy play party book (1940, 1982); Work and sing: an international songbook (1944, 1948); Look away: 50 Negro folk songs (1960, 1963); Songs of all time (1946, 1957); African songs (1958); Songs of the wigwam (1955); Little book of carols (1960); One tune more: songs of America (1961); and Handy folklore (1955); among many others.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: series 1. Custom songbooks and "Kit" recreation publications; series 2. Song sheets; series 3. Production files/custom songbook files; series 4. Song indexes and copyright research.
Arrangement is primarily alphabetical by title.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by Maya Lerman.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: 57 publications have been removed from the collection. A portion of these publications have been transferred to the Library of Congress' General Collections and Music Division. A smaller portion have been deaccessioned according to the Library of Congress' collection policies.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Duplication of collection materials may be governed by copyright and other restrictions.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research; access to collection materials may be restricted. To request materials, please contact the Folklife Reading Room at http://hdl.loc.gov/loc.afc/folklife.contact

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cooperative Recreation Service collection (AFC 2016/051), Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Cooperative Recreation Service was formed as a publishing and distribution center for kits, songbooks, and pamphlets of folk games and songs from the United States and around the world by Lynn Rohrbough and his wife Katherine Ferris Rohrbough in the late 1920s. The Rorhboughs first collected songs and dances while traveling as recreation leaders in churches throughout North America in the 1930s. The publications were sold and distributed to youth agencies and church groups in the United States and internationally.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection of manuscripts and publications comprising the records of the Cooperative Recreation Service (Delaware, Ohio) and additions by subsequent owners, including World Around Songs, a division of Compassion Books, Inc. Includes correspondence with authors and collectors of songs and games; copyright and permission files; most of the original publications of the CRS; folders of individual folk dance and folk song titles pasted-up for publication; and master negatives of songs and games for publication. Genres include American and International folk songs, Contemporary songs, Humorous songs, Work songs, Carols, Rounds, Spirituals, Hymns, and Canons. Popular titles published by the Cooperative Recreation Service include: Handy play party book (1940, 1982); Work and sing: an international songbook (1944, 1948); Look away: 50 Negro folk songs (1960, 1963); Songs of all time (1946, 1957); African songs (1958); Songs of the wigwam (1955); Little book of carols (1960); One tune more: songs of America (1961); and Handy folklore (1955); among many others.

did.unittitle: Series 1. Custom songbooks, "Kit" recreation publications, and selected published materials, ca. 1924-2005

scopecontent.p: This series includes the range of custom songbooks and recreation publications published during the lifespan of Cooperative Recreation Service and including some publications from the transition to World Around Songs publishing company. Arranged alphabetically, each box including a range of songbooks.
